 21  from __future__ import division 
 22  import numpy as np 
 23  import math 
 24  import operator 
 25  from itertools import izip 
 26   
 27  _rotationMatrices = dict( 
 28      x = lambda rx: np.matrix(( 
 29          (1,0,0), 
 30          (0,math.cos(rx),-math.sin(rx)), 
 31          (0,math.sin(rx),math.cos(rx))),dtype=float), 
 32      y = lambda ry: np.matrix(( 
 33          (math.cos(ry),0,math.sin(ry)), 
 34          (0,1,0), 
 35          (-math.sin(ry),0,math.cos(ry))),dtype=float), 
 36      z = lambda rz: np.matrix(( 
 37          (math.cos(rz),-math.sin(rz),0), 
 38          (math.sin(rz),math.cos(rz),0), 
 39          (0,0,1)),dtype=float)) 
 40   
 41  _EPS = 1e-12 
 42   
 43  _eulerFuncs = dict( 
 44      xyz = lambda m: \ 
 45              (np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[2,2]), np.arcsin(m[0,2]), np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0])) if abs(m[0,2]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 46              else (np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1]), np.pi/2, 0) if m[0,2] > 0 \ 
 47              else (-np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1]), -np.pi/2, 0), 
 48      xzy = lambda m: \ 
 49              (np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[1,1]), np.arcsin(-m[0,1]), np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0])) if abs(m[0,1]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 50              else (np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2]), -np.pi/2, 0) if m[0,1] > 0 \ 
 51              else (-np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2]), np.pi/2, 0), 
 52      yxz = lambda m: \ 
 53              (np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[2,2]), np.arcsin(-m[1,2]), np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1])) if abs(m[1,2]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 54              else (np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0]), -np.pi/2, 0) if m[1,2] > 0 \ 
 55              else (-np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0]), np.pi/2, 0), 
 56      yzx = lambda m: \ 
 57              (np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[0,0]), np.arcsin(m[1,0]), np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1])) if abs(m[1,0]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 58              else (np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2]), np.pi/2, 0) if m[1,0] > 0 \ 
 59              else (-np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2]), -np.pi/2, 0), 
 60      zxy = lambda m: \ 
 61              (np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[1,1]), np.arcsin(m[2,1]), np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2])) if abs(m[2,1]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 62              else (np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0]), np.pi/2, 0) if m[2,1] > 0 \ 
 63              else (-np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0]), -np.pi/2, 0), 
 64      zyx = lambda m: \ 
 65              (np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[0,0]), np.arcsin(-m[2,0]), np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2])) if abs(m[2,0]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 66              else (np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1]), -np.pi/2, 0) if m[2,0] > 0 \ 
 67              else (-np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1]), np.pi/2, 0), 
 68      xyx = lambda m: \ 
 69              (np.arctan2(m[1,0], -m[2,0]), np.arccos(m[0,0]), np.arctan2(m[0,1], m[0,2])) if abs(m[0,0]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 70              else (np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1]), 0, 0) if m[0,0] > 0 \ 
 71              else (-np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1]), np.pi, 0), 
 72      xzx = lambda m: \ 
 73              (np.arctan2(m[2,0], m[1,0]), np.arccos(m[0,0]), np.arctan2(m[0,2], -m[0,1])) if abs(m[0,0]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 74              else (np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2]), 0, 0) if m[0,0] > 0 \ 
 75              else (-np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2]), np.pi, 0), 
 76      yxy = lambda m: \ 
 77              (np.arctan2(m[0,1], m[2,1]), np.arccos(m[1,1]), np.arctan2(m[1,0], -m[1,2])) if abs(m[1,1]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 78              else (np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0]), 0, 0) if m[1,1] > 0 \ 
 79              else (-np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0]), np.pi, 0), 
 80      yzy = lambda m: \ 
 81              (np.arctan2(m[2,1], -m[0,1]), np.arccos(m[1,1]), np.arctan2(m[1,2], m[1,0])) if abs(m[1,1]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 82              else (np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2]), 0, 0) if m[1,1] > 0 \ 
 83              else (-np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2]), np.pi, 0), 
 84      zxz = lambda m: \ 
 85              (np.arctan2(m[0,2], -m[1,2]), np.arccos(m[2,2]), np.arctan2(m[2,0], m[2,1])) if abs(m[2,2]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 86              else (np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0]), 0, 0) if m[2,2] > 0 \ 
 87              else (-np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0]), np.pi, 0), 
 88      zyz = lambda m: \ 
 89              (np.arctan2(m[1,2], m[0,2]), np.arccos(m[2,2]), np.arctan2(m[2,1], -m[2,0])) if abs(m[2,2]) < 1 - _EPS \ 
 90              else (np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1]), 0, 0) if m[2,2] > 0 \ 
 91              else (-np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1]), np.pi, 0), 
 92      xy = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[1,1]), np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0])), 
 93      xz = lambda m: (np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[2,2]), np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[0,0])), 
 94      yx = lambda m: (np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[0,0]), np.arctan2(-m[1,2], m[1,1])), 
 95      yz = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[2,2]), np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1])), 
 96      zx = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[0,0]), np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2])), 
 97      zy = lambda m: (np.arctan2(-m[0,1], m[1,1]), np.arctan2(-m[2,0], m[2,2])), 
 98      x = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[2,1], m[2,2]),), 
 99      y = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[0,2], m[0,0]),), 
100      z = lambda m: (np.arctan2(m[1,0], m[1,1]),))

102 -def matrixToEuler(m,order='zyx',inDegrees=True): 

103      """ 
104      Convert a 3x3 rotation matrix to an Euler angle sequence. 
105   
106      @param m: 3x3 L{np.matrix}, or equivalent, to convert. 
107      @param order: The order of the Euler angle sequence, e.g. 'zyx' 
108      @param inDegrees: True to return result in degrees, False for radians. 
109   
110      @return: L{np.ndarray} of Euler angles in specified order. 
111      """ 
112   
113      order = order.lower() 
114      if order not in _eulerFuncs.keys(): 
115          raise NotImplementedError, "Order %s not implemented" % order 
116      result = np.array(_eulerFuncs[order](m)) 
117   
118      if inDegrees: 
119          return np.degrees(result) 
120      else: 
121          return result 

122   

123 -def matrixFromEuler(angles, order, inDegrees=True): 

124      """ 
125      Generate a rotation matrix from an Euler angle sequence. 
126   
127      @param angles: Sequence of Euler rotation angles. 
128      @param order: Sequence of rotation axes. Rotations are applied sequentially 
129          from left to right, i.e. the string 'zyx' would result in rotation about 
130          the Z axis, then the new Y axis, and finally about the new X axis. 
131      @param inDegrees: Whether the angles are in degrees (`True`) or radians 
132          (`False`) 
133      @return: 3x3 rotation matrix corresponding to the Euler angle sequence. 
134      """ 
135   
136      assert len(angles) == len(order) 
137   
138      if inDegrees: 
139          angles = np.radians(angles) 
140   
141      return reduce(operator.mul, 
142              (_rotationMatrices[axis](angle) for axis,angle in 
143                  izip(order.lower(), angles)))
